titleStmt.title: William Kaye to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1184

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
CITY OF LOUISVILLE
PROGRESS
KENTUCKY
Mayor's Office,
Louisville, Ky., Decr 19th 1864
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette
Dr Sir:

Mr Jas J. Gilmore one of our citizens, and who withal is truly loyal, desires to have shipped to him here from New York some fire arms, ammunition & other things belonging to his line of business. He is surviving partner of the late firm of Dickson & Gilmore, who have been carrying on the Gun Making business and keeping a gun store in this City for a number of years past. He is informed, by letter from New York, (which he encloses herewith) that the goods cannot be shipped on a Military order, which he has obtained, but that a permit must be obtained from your Excellency.

In his behalf I respectfully ask that you will have the kindness to grant him such a permit, and enclose it ^to his address^ as soon as your convenience will permit, together with his New York letter, which he desires to file away his papers.

Yours very truly
Wm Kaye, Mayer

Permit Granted
To
Jas J Gilman
on the
letter
20th Dec /64
